page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Oast Houses These are either one two three four or five kilns, the kilns being round or square, very few of them in this area are still used for hop drying, mostly they are used as general stores or converted to living accommodation and sold off from the farm Haymans Hill This was originally Hangmans Hill but no trace of a gibbett could be found Hop Picking This was a great annual event with hordes of people coming usually from the East End of London to live in the Hopper Huts which are now seen in many places although not used for this purpose Pickers would usually come in family groups of up to four generations,many babies were born in huts or barns
